survivor_030_0.title: During the First World War, the mass mobilisation of civilian armies coupled with fighting on an ind
survivor_030_0.abstract: During the First World War, the mass mobilisation of civilian armies coupled with fighting on an industrial scale led to unprecedented numbers of wounded

survivor_030_1.title: The range of weapons used meant there was a wide variety of ways that men could be wounded
survivor_030_1.abstract: The range of weapons used meant there was a wide variety of ways that men could be wounded

survivor_030_2.title: We took part in the assault on Desire Trench and in the morning before it got light, I went up to ha
survivor_030_2.abstract: We took part in the assault on Desire Trench and in the morning before it got light, I went up to have a look round this new ground we’d taken

survivor_030_3.title: I went around with a company commander and was very pleased with what he’d done
survivor_030_3.abstract: I went around with a company commander and was very pleased with what he’d done

survivor_030_4.title: And just as it was getting light, I started off back to my battalion headquarters and I hadn’t gone
survivor_030_4.abstract: And just as it was getting light, I started off back to my battalion headquarters and I hadn’t gone more than a few yards before I was shot in the thigh

survivor_030_5.title: But my unfortunate orderly whom I’d – I thought I was doing the best I could for him – I told him to
survivor_030_5.abstract: But my unfortunate orderly whom I’d – I thought I was doing the best I could for him – I told him to go on when I was hit (that is to say to go back) was hit on the way back and died

survivor_030_6.title: But I came through because I was lifted out by Canadian stretcher-bearers later in the morning
survivor_030_6.abstract: But I came through because I was lifted out by Canadian stretcher-bearers later in the morning

survivor_030_7.title: Well I said, ‘Get down, for God’s sake, or we’ll all be killed
survivor_030_7.abstract: Well I said, ‘Get down, for God’s sake, or we’ll all be killed

survivor_030_8.title: By this time, we was all wounded, the six of us were all wounded, but none of us was killed
survivor_030_8.abstract: By this time, we was all wounded, the six of us were all wounded, but none of us was killed

survivor_030_9.title: And all in the left arm and the left hand
survivor_030_9.abstract: And all in the left arm and the left hand

survivor_030_10.title: This bullet had went into the muscle of my left arm, but it hadn’t touched the bone, it had come rig
survivor_030_10.abstract: This bullet had went into the muscle of my left arm, but it hadn’t touched the bone, it had come right out the back of my arm

survivor_030_11.title: British signaller Leonard Ounsworth was wounded by a shell on the Somme in July 1916 – not that he r
survivor_030_11.abstract: British signaller Leonard Ounsworth was wounded by a shell on the Somme in July 1916 – not that he realised this at first

survivor_030_12.title: Well, they’d both dropped had these two officers in front, and I started off
survivor_030_12.abstract: Well, they’d both dropped had these two officers in front, and I started off

survivor_030_13.title: ’ I said, ‘Yes,’ and so I started to walk on after them, no bones broken
survivor_030_13.abstract: ’ I said, ‘Yes,’ and so I started to walk on after them, no bones broken

survivor_030_14.title: I know I was on guard – you do about two hours each, keeping your eye out in case anything happened
survivor_030_14.abstract: I know I was on guard – you do about two hours each, keeping your eye out in case anything happened – and we suddenly got shelled

survivor_030_15.title: Nobody knew it was mustard gas: nobody knew it was gas at all, they thought it was just being shelle
survivor_030_15.abstract: Nobody knew it was mustard gas: nobody knew it was gas at all, they thought it was just being shelled, you know, like an ordinary barrage all round us

survivor_030_16.title: But what happened, these shells when they burst they’d drop all on the floor, liquid
survivor_030_16.abstract: But what happened, these shells when they burst they’d drop all on the floor, liquid

survivor_030_17.title: Nobody knew until one or two chaps started being sick and a lot of the fellows were laying about goi
survivor_030_17.abstract: Nobody knew until one or two chaps started being sick and a lot of the fellows were laying about going blind and sores all over their eyes

survivor_030_18.title: However a man was wounded, his comrades did their best to help him
survivor_030_18.abstract: However a man was wounded, his comrades did their best to help him

survivor_024_0.title: Donald Murray became aware of increasing preparations during the summer
survivor_024_0.abstract: Donald Murray became aware of increasing preparations during the summer

survivor_024_1.title: We didn’t realise then what was in the offing, but we soon learned because we started making prepara
survivor_024_1.abstract: We didn’t realise then what was in the offing, but we soon learned because we started making preparations, preparing for a really big affair

survivor_024_2.title: We started practising the attack, ready for the big attack, this big attack that was to come
survivor_024_2.abstract: We started practising the attack, ready for the big attack, this big attack that was to come

survivor_024_3.title: I started at dawn and went on until dusk
survivor_024_3.abstract: I started at dawn and went on until dusk

survivor_024_4.title: Every evening a fatigue party arrived with water and food and mail and went away again
survivor_024_4.abstract: Every evening a fatigue party arrived with water and food and mail and went away again

survivor_024_5.title: Then I went back to the battery
survivor_024_5.abstract: Then I went back to the battery

survivor_024_6.title: It went on day after day, there were hours and hours of so much daylight, I wished to God it was mid
survivor_024_6.abstract: It went on day after day, there were hours and hours of so much daylight, I wished to God it was midnight

survivor_024_7.title: It left a vivid impression on all those who witnessed it
survivor_024_7.abstract: It left a vivid impression on all those who witnessed it

survivor_024_8.title: British signaller Harry Wheeler recalled the deafening noise the artillery made
survivor_024_8.abstract: British signaller Harry Wheeler recalled the deafening noise the artillery made

survivor_024_9.title: But the bombardment, when that started, it was what I always called the dance of hell
survivor_024_9.abstract: But the bombardment, when that started, it was what I always called the dance of hell

survivor_024_10.title: Day and night, the shells, heavy and light ones, came upon us
survivor_024_10.abstract: Day and night, the shells, heavy and light ones, came upon us

survivor_024_12.title: Soldiers in the bunkers became hysterical
survivor_024_12.abstract: Soldiers in the bunkers became hysterical

198balloon

They were
taking down dead wire near OP and were
apparently spotted by German observation
198balloon, which sent a recommendation that
they be shelled

He is shelled by us, so close to
our town, that the shrapnel falls into the street,
through the tree
diary_irving_138_1.abstract:
He is shelled by us, so close to
our town, that the shrapnel falls into the street,
through the trees and in the garden

Almost
finished with counting individual sums
diary_irving_110_0.abstract:
Almost

Boiled beef, potatoes, boiled onions,

diary_irving_110_1.abstract:
Boiled beef, potatoes, boiled onions,

diary_irving_110_2.title:
Fox, whom I have always
excelled, is in good form fortunately, for the
success of assignment, but cr
diary_irving_110_2.abstract:
Fox, whom I have always
excelled, is in good form fortunately, for the

wilf_098_0.title:
17
My dear mother, Since last I wrote your two welcome letters arrived after being sent to various a
wilf_098_0.abstract:
17
My dear mother, Since last I wrote your two welcome letters arrived after being sent to various addresses here in search of me

wilf_098_1.title: I hope you have received my letters saying that Jack had arrived safely before this
wilf_098_1.abstract: I hope you have received my letters saying that Jack had arrived safely before this

wilf_098_2.title: We only moved across yesterday & I had a busy day riding over all the Camps to see that they had bee
wilf_098_2.abstract: We only moved across yesterday & I had a busy day riding over all the Camps to see that they had been left in a clean & sanitary condition for the troops who were coming in for their spell on the beach

wilf_098_3.title: I so arranged my day however that I arrived at the Rest Camp which is at present being managed by po
wilf_098_3.abstract: I so arranged my day however that I arrived at the Rest Camp which is at present being managed by portion of the 3rd Ambulance just in time to have a swim & then lunch, or rather we had some morning tea a swim & then lunch

wilf_098_4.title: By that time things were settled down & our bivouacs erected, as I had sent on my batman
wilf_098_4.abstract: By that time things were settled down & our bivouacs erected, as I had sent on my batman

wilf_098_5.title: Today I have been riding round  the Division to see how the people who formerly occupied this area l
wilf_098_5.abstract: Today I have been riding round  the Division to see how the people who formerly occupied this area left it (& it wasn't very good either) & then returned here after lunching at the 4th Ambulance

wilf_098_6.title: The day before we left the beach I rode down to see Worthington who has a Veterinary Section at pres
wilf_098_6.abstract: The day before we left the beach I rode down to see Worthington who has a Veterinary Section at present on the beach - he was once in the 9th Regt at same time as myself & afterwards lived at the Ambulance for a while

wilf_098_7.title: I think I told you that the "baccy" arrived safely thanks very much, if you could get Vice Regal nex
wilf_098_7.abstract: I think I told you that the "baccy" arrived safely thanks very much, if you could get Vice Regal next time I would be very glad of it for a change but please deduct the money from my cheque

wilf_098_8.title: I have not received the parcel yet from the Candelo association but expect it will be along in a day
wilf_098_8.abstract: I have not received the parcel yet from the Candelo association but expect it will be along in a day or two

wilf_098_9.title: In this war one meets people from all the ends of the earth,  - while writing this letter I was inte
wilf_098_9.abstract: In this war one meets people from all the ends of the earth,  - while writing this letter I was interrupted by a young signalling officer who wanted some information, & in conversation afterwards he told me that he was from Canada & began telling me lots of things about it, & yet he had a brother & other relations living in Mudgee

wilf_098_10.title: I heard the other day that young Bob Aspinall had been killed in France - poor kiddy - he was at sch
wilf_098_10.abstract: I heard the other day that young Bob Aspinall had been killed in France - poor kiddy - he was at school & Varsity with me & graduated later, then came over here & I saw him in Egypt before he went to France

I follow without knowledge of
what is to follow
diary_irving_104_0.abstract:
I follow without knowledge of

diary_irving_104_1.title: Steak, onions, boiled potatoes, bread, coffee
diary_irving_104_1.abstract: Steak, onions, boiled potatoes, bread, coffee

survivor_018_0.title: William Davies, who was living in London at the start of the war, remembered civilian reaction to so
survivor_018_0.abstract: William Davies, who was living in London at the start of the war, remembered civilian reaction to soldiers who came home on leave in the early months

survivor_018_1.title: Jack Dorgan of the Northumberland Fusiliers was sent on his first home leave sooner than he had expe
survivor_018_1.abstract: Jack Dorgan of the Northumberland Fusiliers was sent on his first home leave sooner than he had expected

survivor_018_2.title: Our battalion went to France in April 1915 and in the first week in June, the colonel sent for me
survivor_018_2.abstract: Our battalion went to France in April 1915 and in the first week in June, the colonel sent for me

survivor_018_3.title: He says, ‘Sergeant,’ he says, ‘I’ve just received this morning intimation from the War Office that l
survivor_018_3.abstract: He says, ‘Sergeant,’ he says, ‘I’ve just received this morning intimation from the War Office that leave can be started now

survivor_018_4.title: ’ I came out of his dugout, took off my hat – steel helmets weren’t invented then – and I put my Arm
survivor_018_4.abstract: ’ I came out of his dugout, took off my hat – steel helmets weren’t invented then – and I put my Army-issue hat on the bankside and put a bullet through it

survivor_018_5.title: So that when I went home back to England wearing a hat with a bullet hole through I could say, ‘That
survivor_018_5.abstract: So that when I went home back to England wearing a hat with a bullet hole through I could say, ‘That was a near one

survivor_018_6.title: Every 10 months to 18 months – sometimes longer, sometimes shorter but usually about 12 months – we
survivor_018_6.abstract: Every 10 months to 18 months – sometimes longer, sometimes shorter but usually about 12 months – we came on 10 days leave

survivor_018_7.title: That’s when we packed all our gear, went home complete with the dirt we’d accumulated in the front l
survivor_018_7.abstract: That’s when we packed all our gear, went home complete with the dirt we’d accumulated in the front line, and then went home

survivor_018_8.title: Because when I came back here at that time, well Wolverton and Bradwell was more like a ghost town b
survivor_018_8.abstract: Because when I came back here at that time, well Wolverton and Bradwell was more like a ghost town because all your mates had joined the forces

survivor_018_9.title: If you went for a drink in the club or a pub, it seemed that all there was there was old men – well
survivor_018_9.abstract: If you went for a drink in the club or a pub, it seemed that all there was there was old men – well old men then, of course that’d be middle-aged men, men over 40, that wasn’t in the forces

survivor_018_10.title: The first night I came home, I got into my old bed and do you think I could sleep
survivor_018_10.abstract: The first night I came home, I got into my old bed and do you think I could sleep

survivor_018_11.title: And one of the first things I did was resurrected my old bike; pumped the tyres up; oiled it; cleane
survivor_018_11.abstract: And one of the first things I did was resurrected my old bike; pumped the tyres up; oiled it; cleaned it; and I rode round the old country, visiting the old scenes that I knew in peacetime

survivor_018_12.title: So we could go out nearly every day with the same or with another girl and went to theatres and all
survivor_018_12.abstract: So we could go out nearly every day with the same or with another girl and went to theatres and all that

survivor_018_13.title: And that’s when we went to Boulogne
survivor_018_13.abstract: And that’s when we went to Boulogne

wilf_073_0.title: 1916  My dear mother,  Your welcome registered letter arrived a few days after  the other one - I ca
wilf_073_0.abstract: 1916  My dear mother,  Your welcome registered letter arrived a few days after  the other one - I can't just lay my hands on it at present to see if  there is anything to reply to

wilf_073_1.title: We are still in the same place &  are fairly well settled & comfortable though we have been disturbe
wilf_073_1.abstract: We are still in the same place &  are fairly well settled & comfortable though we have been disturbed  lately by frequent alarms - have been turned out to "boot & saddle"  at very short notice but nothing eventuated

wilf_073_2.title: On the last  occasion when we had all assembled & our old Brigadier  was giving a speech a hostile a
wilf_073_2.abstract: On the last  occasion when we had all assembled & our old Brigadier  was giving a speech a hostile aeroplane appeared  overhead & so we all had to scatter in quick time as  bombs might have a big effect on troops packed closely  together

wilf_073_3.title: Since I last wrote you, Stewart & Cave who are in  this Ambulance have been promoted to be Majors, t
wilf_073_3.abstract: Since I last wrote you, Stewart & Cave who are in  this Ambulance have been promoted to be Majors, they have been  out since the very beginning of the war so were quite due for  it

wilf_073_4.title: Stewart has been transferred to another Ambulance &   another fellow named Bassett has been sent her
wilf_073_4.abstract: Stewart has been transferred to another Ambulance &   another fellow named Bassett has been sent here

wilf_073_5.title: of this Ambulance came over to  lunch last week also Dawson who is from Sydney & has  now got his Li
wilf_073_5.abstract: of this Ambulance came over to  lunch last week also Dawson who is from Sydney & has  now got his Lieutenant Colonelrey & one or two others so we  had quite a party

wilf_073_6.title: I went for a ride two or three days ago with  some other officers from the Brigade to some very  int
wilf_073_6.abstract: I went for a ride two or three days ago with  some other officers from the Brigade to some very  interesting ruins situated on the sea coast -  miles from here

wilf_073_7.title: We took our lunch boiled the billy  - I had some sardines & fruit Mab had sent, bread  jam, & someon
wilf_073_7.abstract: We took our lunch boiled the billy  - I had some sardines & fruit Mab had sent, bread  jam, & someone else provided cream cheese & chocolates  - not a bad little spread

wilf_073_8.title: It is 115 yards long by  50 broad, the walls are all demolished but  the bases of the ivory marble p
wilf_073_8.abstract: It is 115 yards long by  50 broad, the walls are all demolished but  the bases of the ivory marble pillars of which  there were about twenty still remain & a  couple of the pillars themselves lie on the  ground

wilf_073_9.title: They are  numbered 1 2 3 4 from left to right & they will require fitting carefully  together by get
wilf_073_9.abstract: They are  numbered 1 2 3 4 from left to right & they will require fitting carefully  together by getting the exact part where one joins the other  cutting away the unnecessary part & then pasting them together  at the back

wilf_073_10.title: So No I 1st on the left my dear then  No ĪĪ on its right & so on
wilf_073_10.abstract: So No I 1st on the left my dear then  No ĪĪ on its right & so on

tom_028_0.title: C5 went with it partly explanatory
tom_028_0.abstract: C5 went with it partly explanatory

wilf_067_0.title:
1916
My dear mother, Your two most welcome letters of Sept 21st & 28th arrived safely this week, rat
wilf_067_0.abstract:
1916
My dear mother, Your two most welcome letters of Sept 21st & 28th arrived safely this week, rather later than the rest of the mail as our New South Wales letters are often a day or two behind the Victorian ones

wilf_067_1.title: Your letters have arrived very regularly now for some time past & I am sorry that you were rather wo
wilf_067_1.abstract: Your letters have arrived very regularly now for some time past & I am sorry that you were rather worrying about them going astray as that occurred only several months ago, & then they turned up in the end

wilf_067_2.title: You were asking how long I was going to stay here, my dear, well really it is very hard to answer, a
wilf_067_2.abstract: You were asking how long I was going to stay here, my dear, well really it is very hard to answer, as one is very much under the Control of the Military authorities & it very largely rests with them, otherwise I don't think I would be here very long, although I suppose one would hardly care to turn his back on things at the present stage

wilf_067_3.title: As regards going to France I don't think it's at all probable that we will be sent there, my dear, &
wilf_067_3.abstract: As regards going to France I don't think it's at all probable that we will be sent there, my dear, & if we are - well "Kismet" we have to go

wilf_067_4.title:
I have just been eating a piece of a beauty which was sent from 
England to Cave one of the officers
wilf_067_4.abstract:
I have just been eating a piece of a beauty which was sent from 
England to Cave one of the officers here & we have had part of it for afternoon tea We are living quite well, have our own cook who was once a chef in one of the best places in Melbourne & also have an orderly to wait on us

wilf_067_5.title: Several others of my friends have been killed in France besides Graham - W Jekyll & Broughton were t
wilf_067_5.abstract: Several others of my friends have been killed in France besides Graham - W Jekyll & Broughton were two fine fellows both in my year at the Varsity & then several others in the years above & below

wilf_067_6.title: Football is in full swing at present, matches have been arranged between the different regiments & i
wilf_067_6.abstract: Football is in full swing at present, matches have been arranged between the different regiments & it is quite pleasant to go & look at the matches although they play a different game to our usual one in N

wilf_067_7.title: I hope you received the last letter safely with all the photos in it as you would find them interest
wilf_067_7.abstract: I hope you received the last letter safely with all the photos in it as you would find them interesting

wilf_067_8.title: I'm getting quite a corporation, it looks as if I will present the good old picture of a family doc
wilf_067_8.abstract: I'm getting quite a corporation, it looks as if I will present the good old picture of a family doc when I return, nice & portly & bald

Harold11_0.title:
am going to write as usual - but especially so today, as
this afternoon your letter Pet 6th came to
Harold11_0.abstract:
am going to write as usual - but especially so today, as
this afternoon your letter Pet 6th came to hand, I was
exceedingly surprised to hear you'd had nothing from me
since Dec 23- it was very disappointing to hear that for
I had sent a letter & parcel from Cairo on Jantor - brstheday
present for mum - & about a week later another parael bende
the regular letter & lmas wishes

Harold11_1.title:
Wumps also wrote - practically an ultimation becouse
I had not written to her - well with shofting a
Harold11_1.abstract:
Wumps also wrote - practically an ultimation becouse
I had not written to her - well with shofting about
training - lecturing, working all day long, t one does
not feel up to writing

Harold11_2.title:
Iit has been an effort to even
write to you - for really were no news to send
Uncle Will also wrote
Harold11_2.abstract:
Iit has been an effort to even
write to you - for really were no news to send
Uncle Will also wrote mentioning that he expected
should be a capt

Harold11_3.title:
are excellent men they are batting
hard for us - & I told me I was recommended
so dve not put my tai
Harold11_3.abstract:
are excellent men they are batting
hard for us - & I told me I was recommended
so dve not put my tail between my legs yet

Harold11_4.title:
Its a durned shame that such musteryevers
should make a blot on the name of Anzac
Fancy Ireland havi
Harold11_4.abstract:
Its a durned shame that such musteryevers
should make a blot on the name of Anzac
Fancy Ireland having to be recalled - surely dity
was sufficient

Harold11_5.title:
3 16
Your birthday started today Dad & you should
have read a letter with blotholon peetings
Harold11_5.abstract:
3 16
Your birthday started today Dad & you should
have read a letter with blotholon peetings

Harold11_6.title:
I went out this afternoon to make a thorough reconmaning
of Arabis trenches
Harold11_6.abstract:
I went out this afternoon to make a thorough reconmaning
of Arabis trenches

Harold11_7.title:
Ken Wewin is ie Batt Crderky Room
Had a long talk with Guor, just before we came tack
over the lanal
Harold11_7.abstract:
Ken Wewin is ie Batt Crderky Room
Had a long talk with Guor, just before we came tack
over the lanal - he looked very well

Harold11_8.title:
F areas from which th
came
Harold11_8.abstract:

Harold11_9.title:
The backfround shows up well we could
do with a eight of those pines here it would do our
eyeright g
Harold11_9.abstract:
The backfround shows up well we could
do with a eight of those pines here it would do our
eyeright good after so much of this sany dicet life
Cansorship is very strict so no news to send
much lone, best manen, shopes youne as well, as
call

Enclosed supps may be handy- showing
Egghtian types of life some I mean to get entarged
native home is mud walled but royed only in port trushes
nactive bllafe makes a gova preture
The chost like lady on the truck was annoyed, when I tak
her photo the women dislike being plectoed hence my wartirng
for 2 them round a cooner not a bad enap either
The hest is the little firl water carrier – the smile nut me
2a partre ()

tom_014_0.title: My Dear Sweetheart, I have left writing to you until Sunday afternoon this week
tom_014_0.abstract: My Dear Sweetheart, I have left writing to you until Sunday afternoon this week

tom_014_1.title: She wrote a general letter & very kindly offered to send anything I wanted in the way of socks, body
tom_014_1.abstract: She wrote a general letter & very kindly offered to send anything I wanted in the way of socks, body belts etc

tom_014_2.title: She mentions that Mr & Mrs Fallon called before leaving in the 'Osterley' Here is an extract from St
tom_014_2.abstract:
She mentions that Mr & Mrs Fallon called before leaving in the 'Osterley' Here is an extract from Stewarts letter 'I'm shortly going to desert & make for a 
cavalry regiment

tom_014_3.title: We then marched past in column of route (fours) & did it very well, so they told us
tom_014_3.abstract: We then marched past in column of route (fours) & did it very well, so they told us

tom_014_4.title: 30 one or two tents collapsed on their occupants & the band started to quietly assemble
tom_014_4.abstract: 30 one or two tents collapsed on their occupants & the band started to quietly assemble

tom_014_5.title: More tents collapsed and down went the canteen tent
tom_014_5.abstract: More tents collapsed and down went the canteen tent

tom_014_6.title:
The [[niggers]] inside were moaning in a most heartrending
way when it started to shake
tom_014_6.abstract:
The [[niggers]] inside were moaning in a most heartrending
way when it started to shake

tom_014_7.title: We started off on a procession with the band, armed with every conceivable piece of metal capable of
tom_014_7.abstract: We started off on a procession with the band, armed with every conceivable piece of metal capable of making a row Along the main road (named Canberra Road) we marched, picking up bands & half clothed soldiers until we must have been 2000 strong

tom_014_8.title: Those who had had a drop were just in the right state to keep us amused New Years day we started on
tom_014_8.abstract: Those who had had a drop were just in the right state to keep us amused New Years day we started on the new Company formations

bob_098_0.title:
Author: Robert James Henderson

Location: Belgium
 Date: 25th June 1917

My dear Mum, Arrived back w
bob_098_0.abstract:
Author: Robert James Henderson

Location: Belgium
 Date: 25th June 1917

My dear Mum, Arrived back with the Battn last Saturday night from La Motte we are close to the line doing fatigue work which is all right except we are working under shell fire and usually lose a few men each day

bob_098_1.title: We are leading for the cricket cup having a good game against the 4th Field Ambulance yesterday whom
bob_098_1.abstract: We are leading for the cricket cup having a good game against the 4th Field Ambulance yesterday whom we beat by 20 runs with ten minutes  to go  started at 4-30PM and finished at 8-20PM when it was quite light if we meet the 16th Battn next Wednesday if not in the line again by that time

bob_098_2.title: Humphrey Browning is back again with the Battn and several other officers so we are fairly well off
bob_098_2.abstract: Humphrey Browning is back again with the Battn and several other officers so we are fairly well off in that respect at present

bob_098_3.title: Harry  Murray saw Len while he was across in England visiting the Henley's at the Windsor Hotel told
bob_098_3.abstract: Harry  Murray saw Len while he was across in England visiting the Henley's at the Windsor Hotel told me he was OK had his star up and I guess swanking in London generally unfortunately expect he will be across here again shortly hope to goodness his luck sticks to him Toby Bartons brother who has just received his commission and rejoined the 45th was killed in the last stunt isn't it rotten for his mother both boys gone now

bob_098_4.title: Well I have to  go and get the team practicing for the next match also a lot of letters to censor al
bob_098_4.abstract: Well I have to  go and get the team practicing for the next match also a lot of letters to censor also some bridge to play everyone is back  from work having started at 3 am this  morning best love to all Bob Bad luck missing my last mail  it has been sent on to England but hope some comes back eventually

James2_0.title:
collect from Valley of Death in afternoon & again out at 8 pm 2nd May Sun
Have a rest & watch the Na
James2_0.abstract:
collect from Valley of Death in afternoon & again out at 8 pm 2nd May Sun
Have a rest & watch the Navy heavily bombard observation station at Gaba Tepe also on the left flank

James2_2.title:
Rush hit on foot May 6th Thurs
Our camp under very heavy shrapnel fire all day & we crouch as far ba
James2_2.abstract:
Rush hit on foot May 6th Thurs
Our camp under very heavy shrapnel fire all day & we crouch as far back a possible in our dug-outs 70 mules & many men killed & hundreds of wonderful escapes all around us
Shep shot through foot & Baker through hand

James2_3.title: Go out to left flank to see G Henderson in afternoon & have a good yarn
James2_3.abstract: Go out to left flank to see G Henderson in afternoon & have a good yarn

James2_4.title: Have a race for life from 4th Dressing Stn, between the barricades, but see 5 shot dead and many wou
James2_4.abstract: Have a race for life from 4th Dressing Stn, between the barricades, but see 5 shot dead and many wounded

James2_5.title: Heavy Xplosive shells sent over our camp in evening but few hurt
James2_5.abstract: Heavy Xplosive shells sent over our camp in evening but few hurt

James2_6.title:
May 10th Mon
Hear Cuckoo, Many shells sent to our camp but nobody hit
James2_6.abstract:
May 10th Mon
Hear Cuckoo, Many shells sent to our camp but nobody hit

James2_7.title: May 13th Thurs Darcy wounded in arm (venous)
James2_7.abstract: May 13th Thurs Darcy wounded in arm (venous)

James2_8.title:
Our position shelled periodically little damage 
May 14th Friday Our position getting hell
James2_8.abstract:
Our position shelled periodically little damage 
May 14th Friday Our position getting hell

James2_9.title: One 3rd Batt man killed just below us and while Capt Connek & one of our squads were attending him a
James2_9.abstract: One 3rd Batt man killed just below us and while Capt Connek & one of our squads were attending him a shell burst within a foot or two of them, a little later a 4

James2_10.title: 7 cut through the corner of my dug out & shattered Pens right leg & tore up T Jones left leg, dig de
James2_10.abstract: 7 cut through the corner of my dug out & shattered Pens right leg & tore up T Jones left leg, dig deeper at night

James2_11.title: Take a walk in evening to left where we landed May 17th Mon Heavy shelling again
James2_11.abstract: Take a walk in evening to left where we landed May 17th Mon Heavy shelling again

James2_12.title:
Part of 2nd Bde disembark again after being relieved at C Helles by RMLI's
May 18th Tues Turks attem
James2_12.abstract:
Part of 2nd Bde disembark again after being relieved at C Helles by RMLI's
May 18th Tues Turks attempt to mount guns on our left but the Lindon & Triumph soon get their range & fire two villiages & reported to blow up their batteries J Aber & a hundred other recovered cases come ashore at 6 pm

James2_13.title: Jack Simpson killed while  leading donk & patient
James2_13.abstract: Jack Simpson killed while  leading donk & patient

James2_14.title: Orders to sleep fully dressed & have to turn out for we are attacked by  Turks (heavily) who are rep
James2_14.abstract: Orders to sleep fully dressed & have to turn out for we are attacked by  Turks (heavily) who are repulsed with terrible losses

James2_15.title: cut off previous night in an advanced trench
James2_15.abstract: cut off previous night in an advanced trench

dud_003_0.title: Letter sent in respect of Lieutenant A
dud_003_0.abstract: Letter sent in respect of Lieutenant A

dud_003_1.title:
Henderson, 

Regiment: 7th Battalion, AIF, who died of wounds on board a hospital transport between
dud_003_1.abstract:
Henderson, 

Regiment: 7th Battalion, AIF, who died of wounds on board a hospital transport between 27 and 30 April 1915 (his father says he died on the night of April 25); and of Captain R

dud_003_2.title: , who while (according to his father) in command of his battalion, the other senior officers having
dud_003_2.abstract: , who while (according to his father) in command of his battalion, the other senior officers having previously been hit, was killed in action on 8 May 1915 during the Second Battle of Krithia in Gallipoli

dud_003_3.title: Henderson: Accountant; of Hawthorn, Victoria; born Hawthorn, 8 July 1894; educated at Trinity Gramma
dud_003_3.abstract: Henderson: Accountant; of Hawthorn, Victoria; born Hawthorn, 8 July 1894; educated at Trinity Grammar School, Kew, Victoria; served in the junior and senior cadets of the C

dud_003_4.title: Henderson: Estate agent; of Hawthorn; born Hawthorn; educated at Trinity Grammar School, Kew; served
dud_003_4.abstract: Henderson: Estate agent; of Hawthorn; born Hawthorn; educated at Trinity Grammar School, Kew; served in junior and senior cadets, and was a captain in the Citizen Forces; age at time of death, 22

will_010_0.title: I was so glad too to get the little snap shots you sent
will_010_0.abstract: I was so glad too to get the little snap shots you sent

will_010_1.title: I have found him such a good fellow to work with in every way - always wanting to do his best to hel
will_010_1.abstract: I have found him such a good fellow to work with in every way - always wanting to do his best to help us, & as you may care to see it I enclose such a nice letter he wrote me saying good bye

will_010_2.title: They however I fear will not come in, at all events at present, or in time to do us much good
will_010_2.abstract: They however I fear will not come in, at all events at present, or in time to do us much good

will_010_3.title: It takes a long time though to settle details which are endless in such matters & I certainly though
will_010_3.abstract: It takes a long time though to settle details which are endless in such matters & I certainly thought we should have landed a good fortnight earlier than we did - one lucky thing we didn't do so was that settled fine weather only started the day we landed & it has been absolutely lovely ever since - just perfect summer weather

will_010_4.title: I imagine she will be rather Australian, but it was nice of her to have called
will_010_4.abstract: I imagine she will be rather Australian, but it was nice of her to have called

will_038_0.title: And I have just had a wire to  say that an Austrian submarine has captured the mails we  sent from h
will_038_0.abstract: And I have just had a wire to  say that an Austrian submarine has captured the mails we  sent from here on 30th last month - they say that some of the letters were  rescued by two ladies

will_038_1.title: I certainly sent one letter by him to you -  and I rather think two, for there had been no chance of
will_038_1.abstract: I certainly sent one letter by him to you -  and I rather think two, for there had been no chance of writing  for some time - and I think I sent letters to both Nancy & Chris  with photos & stamps

will_038_2.title: It is hard to remember what letters went  by that particular mail, but I rather think it would have
will_038_2.abstract: It is hard to remember what letters went  by that particular mail, but I rather think it would have contained   a long one I wrote from H

will_038_3.title: Mrs Hilton's money  for Chris - all the parcels you have sent me, & all of which I have  I think rec
will_038_3.abstract: Mrs Hilton's money  for Chris - all the parcels you have sent me, & all of which I have  I think received - your investments etc

will_038_4.title: Isn't it awfully   annoying this sort of thing happening, for it means one never  knows where one is
will_038_4.abstract: Isn't it awfully   annoying this sort of thing happening, for it means one never  knows where one is - what we have either of us received or not,  if letters are liable to be captured one has to be so very  careful in future to write nothing about events here

will_038_5.title: I hope Major Storr will have sent you that New Zealand greenstone "Tiki" which Sir H
will_038_5.abstract: I hope Major Storr will have sent you that New Zealand greenstone "Tiki" which Sir H

will_038_7.title: I think he was then, or became afterwards Pollok- Moins, but has now become Pollok-McCall - money I
will_038_7.abstract: I think he was then, or became afterwards Pollok- Moins, but has now become Pollok-McCall - money I suppose  in commanding a Territorial Brigade

norm_058_0.title: My Dearest Mother, & all at Home, I have at last received the long-looked for parcels
norm_058_0.abstract: My Dearest Mother, & all at Home, I have at last received the long-looked for parcels

norm_058_1.title: As you already know, it is the coldest weather for years, & the water is frozen everywhere, - even i
norm_058_1.abstract: As you already know, it is the coldest weather for years, & the water is frozen everywhere, - even in the fire buckets in the huts, & we have to light fires under the troughs to give the horses a drink, & so you can see that the vest was sorely tried, but came out "trumps"

jim_048_0.title: His division has been shifted from the Somme front, and they are at present near Ypres in Flanders f
jim_048_0.abstract: His division has been shifted from the Somme front, and they are at present near Ypres in Flanders from what I can hear

jim_048_1.title: I am afraid the parcels sent by Ruby and yourselves will never reach me
jim_048_1.abstract: I am afraid the parcels sent by Ruby and yourselves will never reach me

jim_048_2.title: I have been recommended for 3 months' light duty in England by the O
jim_048_2.abstract: I have been recommended for 3 months' light duty in England by the O

jim_048_3.title: It is 8 weeks since they occurred, so you can see how things are
jim_048_3.abstract: It is 8 weeks since they occurred, so you can see how things are

jim_048_4.title: They are not merely skilled workers, but absolutely qualified explosive experts, so one can pardon t
jim_048_4.abstract: They are not merely skilled workers, but absolutely qualified explosive experts, so one can pardon them for not wanting to go to France

bob_067_0.title: Had made all arrangements to leave the hospital  tomorrow in fact booked at a room at the Jermyn Cou
bob_067_0.abstract: Had made all arrangements to leave the hospital  tomorrow in fact booked at a room at the Jermyn Court hotel Piccadilly where I intended to stay for a while until I had my medical board & found out how much leave I get  Asked the doctor to sign my papers for discharge to-day he had a look at my leg and said he would recomend me for light duty told him that was no good to me stuck in camp somewhere  in England he said  if I went back to France now it might break down again still I do not believe him it feels quite strong again now however he induced me to wait and see the specialist who operated and get his advice tomorrow on the matter shall let you know later the result Feel as if I could go back  now but will not do so against his advice

bob_067_1.title: Then you know my dear one is contracting bad habits you know when one can go out when one likes and
bob_067_1.abstract: Then you know my dear one is contracting bad habits you know when one can go out when one likes and  come in when one likes nothing to do all day and a little money to spend how simple it is to get contract bad habits especially in London Still have looked at things from the proper  standpoint to date but after this long spell shall  find it hard to settle down to work again Have finished up with the dentist now thank goodness and hope to have no more trouble with my teeth for the duration Any how while at dinner two nights ago there was  a terrific explosion The conclusion was that bad windows crashed etc  thought it was bombs from a Zepplin but proved to be a munition factory blown up almost 3 miles  away

bob_067_2.title: The damage & loss of life was bad but of course very vague information has come through they cannot
bob_067_2.abstract: The damage & loss of life was bad but of course very vague information has come through they cannot  say much about these things in the press at the present time Have no more news for the present  Trust you are all well at home love to all, Bob
